trans-unit.source: Throw exception if configured incorrectly: Recommended for new installation - LDAP authentication is not compatible with loginSecurityLevel set to "challenged" or "superchallenged" since the real password can never be sent against the LDAP repository. Instead of failing silently, the extension will throw an exception at login. If the method appears to be brutal it will save a lot of headaches. Value of loginSecurityLevel should be handled manually to "normal" or even better "rsa" in the Install Tool.
Force lower-case user name: If checked, user names will be always be stored in lower-cases. Useful for case-sensitive databases.
Backend LDAP authentication: Enable LDAP authentication for the backend.
Backend user group must exist: If no groups are found locally, the user may not log on.
Backend user must exist: If checked, users that are not already present in TYPO3 may not log on.
Enable local Backend users: If checked, Backend users without a reference to LDAP (e.g., "admin") may log on.
Disable Backend group synchronization: If checked, TYPO3 Backend user groups will not get updated.
Keep Backend groups: Keep the Backend user groups assigned locally.
Backend SSO: Enable Single Sign-On for Backend users.
Backend SSO: Keep the domain name after a successfull login (for example on a CAS-Server), to continue the chain of authentication through LDAP.
Frontend LDAP authentication: Enable LDAP authentication for the frontend.
Purge Frontend users: Delete Frontend user upon login if no LDAP groups are found.
Restrict new Frontend users: This option will prevent new Frontend users to be created and will delete existing ones whenever the LDAP groups they are member of are not found locally.
Frontend user group must exist: If no groups are found locally, the user may not log on.
Frontend user must exist: If checked, users that are not already present in TYPO3 may not log on.
Disable Frontend group synchronization: If checked, TYPO3 Frontend user groups will not get updated.
Keep Frontend groups: Keep the Frontend user groups assigned locally.
Frontend SSO: Enable Single Sign-On for Frontend users.
Frontend SSO: Keep the domain name after a successfull login (for example on a CAS-Server), to continue the chain of authentication through LDAP.
This extension has been successfully configured.

LDAP authentification for Website-Users (FE) is not compatible with loginSecurityLevel set to "challenged" or "superchallenged" since the real password can never be sent against the LDAP repository.

Value of loginSecurityLevel should be changed manually to "normal" or even better "rsa" in the Install Tool.

$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['FE']['loginSecurityLevel'] = 'normal';
$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['FE']['loginSecurityLevel'] = 'rsa';

LDAP authentification for backend is not compatible with loginSecurityLevel set to "challenged" or "superchallenged" since the real password can never be sent against the LDAP repository.

Value of loginSecurityLevel should be changed manually to "normal" or even better "rsa" in the Install Tool.

$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['BE']['loginSecurityLevel'] = 'normal';
$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['BE']['loginSecurityLevel'] = 'rsa';

Current value for frontend is: "%s"
Current value for backend is: "%s"
Group contains the list of its members
User contains the list of its associated groups

Mapping for field "usergroup" is missing in the configuration of frontend users. You may end up importing ALL groups in LDAP into TYPO3 and get users associated to wrong groups. Suggestion: usergroup = <memberOf>

Mapping for field "usergroup" is missing in the configuration of backend users. You may end up importing ALL groups in LDAP into TYPO3 and get users associated to wrong groups. Suggestion: usergroup = <memberOf>
